snippet: Herman Van Rompuy, the president of the European Council, said there was little appetite to reopen treaties to address critics of “federal Euroland.”
abstract: European Council Pres Herman Van Rompuy warns of widespread opposition to altering European Union treaties in order to appease countries like Great Britain that remain outside the euro zone; remarks are pointed warning to Prime Min David Cameron, who has promised British voters a referendum within five years on whether to stay in bloc on revised terms or leave.
lead_paragraph: Herman Van Rompuy, the president of the European Council, said there was little appetite to reopen treaties to address critics of “federal Euroland.”

headline.main: Veiled Warning to Britain From a Bloc Leader
headline.print_headline: Veiled Warning to Britain From a Bloc Leader
